docs.abstract: “Unfortunately, this virus laid bare the severe shortcomings of the current administration,” Mr. Biden said. In his own address, Mr. Sanders said the coronavirus crisis was “on the scale of major war.”
docs.snippet: “Unfortunately, this virus laid bare the severe shortcomings of the current administration,” Mr. Biden said. In his own address, Mr. Sanders said the coronavirus crisis was “on the scale of major war.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Thursday delivered a forceful rebuke of President Trump’s leadership amid the coronavirus crisis, seeking to project steadiness and resolve from his perch as the front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination.

headline.main: Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders Rebuke Trump Over Virus: ‘The Clock Is Ticking’
headline.print_headline: Biden and Sanders Offer Response Plans, and Sharp Rebukes of Trump’s

byline.original: By Katie Glueck and Sydney Ember

docs.abstract: Mr. Sanders said he was not dropping out, but aides said he recognized time was running short. He listed a series of policy items in what could be seen as a wish list of concessions he would want.
docs.snippet: Mr. Sanders said he was not dropping out, but aides said he recognized time was running short. He listed a series of policy items in what could be seen as a wish list of concessions he would want.
docs.lead_paragraph: BURLINGTON, Vt. — Senator Bernie Sanders on Wednesday made a defiant case for his liberal policy agenda despite suffering big losses in the Democratic primaries this week, saying he planned to continue his bid for the presidency. But he acknowledged that he was “losing the debate over electability” to his rival, former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

headline.main: Behind Bernie Sanders’s Decision to Stay in the Race
headline.print_headline: Odds Longer, Sanders Pushes On From the Left

byline.original: By Sydney Ember, Reid J. Epstein and Glenn Thrush

docs.abstract: As Bernie Sanders has seen his fortunes slide, he has cited a number of factors that portray him as an aggrieved outsider.
docs.snippet: As Bernie Sanders has seen his fortunes slide, he has cited a number of factors that portray him as an aggrieved outsider.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS — To Senator Bernie Sanders, there is plenty of blame to go around when it comes to his recent reversal of fortune. For everyone but him and his campaign.

headline.main: The Media. Young Voters. Sanders Spreads the Blame for His Decline.
headline.print_headline: Sanders Spreads Blame for His Falling Behind

docs.abstract: Following President Trump’s lead, many commentators have played down fears.
docs.snippet: Following President Trump’s lead, many commentators have played down fears.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sean Hannity used his syndicated talk-radio program on Wednesday to share a prediction he had found on Twitter about what is really happening with the coronavirus: It’s a “fraud” by the deep state to spread panic in the populace, manipulate the economy and suppress dissent.

headline.main: How Right-Wing Pundits Are Covering Coronavirus
headline.print_headline: To Doctors, It’s a Crisis.  To Hannity, It’s a ‘Hoax.’

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Michael M. Grynbaum

docs.abstract: The debate between Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders was hosted by CNN and Univision. It took place in Washington, D.C., because of concerns over the coronavirus.
docs.snippet: The debate between Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders was hosted by CNN and Univision. It took place in Washington, D.C., because of concerns over the coronavirus.
docs.lead_paragraph: The large field of Democrats is now down to only two major candidates: former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont. Because of concerns about the coronavirus, the debate was moved from Phoenix to Washington, D.C.

headline.main: Highlights From the March Democratic Debate

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein, Katie Glueck and Shane Goldmacher

docs.abstract: With the coronavirus as a backdrop, and with no audience in attendance, the two Democrats were at times feisty discussing their differences over health care. Mr. Biden also committed to choosing a woman as a running mate.
docs.snippet: With the coronavirus as a backdrop, and with no audience in attendance, the two Democrats were at times feisty discussing their differences over health care. Mr. Biden also committed to choosing a woman as a running mate.
docs.lead_paragraph: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator Bernie Sanders called for vastly more aggressive government action to battle the coronavirus but split over some of the details along familiar ideological lines on Sunday night, as the two Democrats tangled over the right to lead their party into a campaign overshadowed by the pandemic inflicting havoc on the country’s economy and its social fabric.

headline.main: Biden and Sanders Fight Over Policy and Records in Head-to-Head Debate
headline.print_headline: Two Rivals Take On Outbreak, and Each Other

byline.original: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

docs.abstract: The amicable relationship the two have maintained could become an important factor in the Democrats’ ability to unite quickly against President Trump.
docs.snippet: The amicable relationship the two have maintained could become an important factor in the Democrats’ ability to unite quickly against President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: In October 2015, Senator Bernie Sanders was whisked into Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s residence at the Naval Observatory for a breakfast of yogurt parfaits and caffeinated campaign advice from a vice president who had just announced his (temporary) retirement from presidential politics.

headline.main: For Biden and Sanders, the Fight’s Not Personal
headline.print_headline: To Biden and Sanders, Ex-Senate Colleagues, The Fight Isn’t Personal

docs.abstract: The two septuagenarian Democratic candidates were asked at Sunday’s debate what they were doing to ensure they remained healthy.
docs.snippet: The two septuagenarian Democratic candidates were asked at Sunday’s debate what they were doing to ensure they remained healthy.
docs.lead_paragraph: After more than 30 minutes of posing questions almost entirely about policy and decision-making related to coronavirus, Dana Bash, one of CNN’s moderators for Sunday’s Democratic debate, took a moment to make the topic deeply personal.

headline.main: How Are Biden and Sanders Protecting Themselves Against Coronavirus?

docs.abstract: The polls in California, the state with more than 30 percent of the delegates at stake on Tuesday, closed at 11 p.m. Eastern. It will take a long time to count all the votes.
docs.snippet: The polls in California, the state with more than 30 percent of the delegates at stake on Tuesday, closed at 11 p.m. Eastern. It will take a long time to count all the votes.
docs.lead_paragraph: As Super Tuesday votes were being counted on Wednesday morning, the biggest question was how many delegates each candidate would win.

headline.main: Want to Know Who Won Super Tuesday? Get Ready to Wait.

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Maggie Astor

docs.abstract: Joe Biden was strong in the South and scored victories in Texas, Minnesota and Massachusetts, while Bernie Sanders won California.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden was strong in the South and scored victories in Texas, Minnesota and Massachusetts, while Bernie Sanders won California.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fourteen states held primary elections in today’s Super Tuesday contests, including the two that award the most delegates, California and Texas, as well as a number of critical general-election swing states. Here’s a look at six of the most interesting battlegrounds.

headline.main: Super Tuesday States: A Look at Six Key Battlegrounds
